thread.title: DB target plans to visit soon
thread.title_full: DB target plans to visit soon

title: DB target plans to visit soon
text:
DB target plans to visit soon This defensive back is adding offers every week. He plans to be in Athens, Ga. soon. Slot to Georgia Links 
Defensive back Chris Smith (Atlanta/Hapeville Charter) has picked up recent offers from Alabama, Maryland, Duke, Louisville, Oregon, N.C. State, and Michigan State. The Alabama offer sticks out to the 6-foot, 165-pound junior, along with a pair of SEC programs. 
"UGA and Auburn," Smith said, on vsporto's SEC Recruiting Buzz. "I talk to the coaches all the time. I talked to Coach Smart a few weeks ago and he just said he likes the way I play. He likes my physicalness. He wants to get me up." 
(What's next for the Bulldogs? Make sure you're in the loop -- take a few moments to sign up for our FREE Bulldogs Newsletter! ) 
Smith, who received an offer from the Bulldogs in November, plans to be up in Athens, Ga. very soon. 
"I think I am going up there on the 18th when they have a basketball game against Kentucky," Smith said. 
Smith has a high school teammate who just signed with Georgia in defensive back William Poole III . 
"He said it feels like home," Smith said. "He likes the family environment and he feels like he has a good opportunity to play. So do I - I think he will be able to go up there and play very well. He said the coaches are cool and when I get up there on the 18th I will be able to see more of the campus." 
Another SEC program is recruiting him the hardest. 
"I would say South Carolina is recruiting me the hardest, and then a very close second would be UGA," Smith said. 
Smith is trying to formulate a plan for making a decision. 
"I plan to narrow things down after the school year," Smith said. "People are still coming up here and giving me offers, so I want to make sure all the schools interested in me have an opportunity to recruit me before I narrow it down. When I plan to sign? After seeing those guys on national signing day 2017, that was pretty special and I really liked that. Signing day might be when I announce my decision, but my schools would be very narrow by then. I might even silent commit. Or, if I choose early enrollment it would be before December. I have not really made my decision, but I know it is getting close to crunch time. I have to make a decision because spots are closing up. Start SlideShow 
Listen to the full interview above, which Smith discussing other programs and includes a breakdown of him as a prospect and insight into his recruitment. Stay up to date on SEC recruiting by listening to episodes of the SEC Recruiting Buzz here . Subscribe to the podcast on iTunes here , and on google play here .
